DataElement.preferredName: Central Laboratory Hepatitis B Virus Hepatitis C Virus Outcome Received Ind-3
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response used to determine whether or not Hepatitis B Virus and Hepatitis C Virus results from a laboratory delivering the data for a particular study had been received.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Central Laboratory Hepatitis B Virus Hepatitis C Virus Outcome Receive
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A laboratory delivering the data for a particular study._Hepatitis B Virus (HBV) is the prototype of the Hepadnavirus Family.  Included in the family are the Woodchuck Hepatitis Virus (WHV) and the Duck Hepatitis B Virus (DHBV) which provide animal models of infection.  The HBV genome is a partially double stranded circular DNA.  A viral reverse transcriptase is bound to the 5' extremity of the long strand._A small, enveloped, positive sense single strand RNA virus in the family Flaviviridae. The genome consists of a single RNA molecule with a single open reading frame._The result of an action._To take, accept, or get something offered.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A laboratory delivering the data for a particular study.

Concepts.definition: A laboratory delivering the data for a particular study.

Property.preferredName: Hepatitis B Virus Hepatitis C Virus Outcome Receive
Property.preferredDefinition: Hepatitis B Virus (HBV) is the prototype of the Hepadnavirus Family.  Included in the family are the Woodchuck Hepatitis Virus (WHV) and the Duck Hepatitis B Virus (DHBV) which provide animal models of infection.  The HBV genome is a partially double stranded circular DNA.  A viral reverse transcriptase is bound to the 5' extremity of the long strand.:A small, enveloped, positive sense single strand RNA virus in the family Flaviviridae. The genome consists of a single RNA molecule with a single open reading frame.:The result of an action.:To take, accept, or get something offered.

Concepts.definition: Hepatitis B Virus (HBV) is the prototype of the Hepadnavirus Family.  Included in the family are the Woodchuck Hepatitis Virus (WHV) and the Duck Hepatitis B Virus (DHBV) which provide animal models of infection.  The HBV genome is a partially double stranded circular DNA.  A viral reverse transcriptase is bound to the 5' extremity of the long strand.
A small, enveloped, positive sense single strand RNA virus in the family Flaviviridae. The genome consists of a single RNA molecule with a single open reading frame.
To take, accept, or get something offered.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
